label: 寺田
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: Tax free rice fields (fuyusoden) granted in perpetuity by the government to Buddhist temples. Later such grants were made by private persons, and many new rice fields (konden) were opened from waste land by the temples. [不輸租田、墾田]
